title: Kyriakos the Grain Merchant
description: A wealthy merchant who cheats the poor with false weights

lines.speaker: Kyriakos
lines.text: You! What do you want? If you're not buying, move along. This is a place of business.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (The merchant is well-fed, his clothes fine. Behind him, sacks of grain are stacked high.)

choices.text: That's a lot of grain. Prices must be good.

buy_grain.speaker: Kyriakos
buy_grain.text: Buying? Well, that's different. You don't look like you have much coin, but everyone eats.

buy_grain.speaker: Kyriakos
buy_grain.text: One follis gets you this much. (He scoops grain into a small measure.)

buy_grain.speaker: You
buy_grain.text: (You watch carefully. The scoop he uses seems... lighter than it should be.)

buy_grain.speaker: Kyriakos
buy_grain.text: Fair price for fair grain. Best wheat from Egypt.

confront_scoop.speaker: Kyriakos
confront_scoop.text: What? This is a standard measure! Approved by the city.

confront_scoop.speaker: You
confront_scoop.text: I've seen standard measures before. This one has a false bottom.

confront_scoop.speaker: Kyriakos
confront_scoop.text: (His face flushes red.) You dare accuse me? Who are you?

confront_scoop.speaker: Kyriakos
confront_scoop.text: I know your type. Thieves who can't steal, so they shake down honest men.

confront_scoop.speaker: Kyriakos
confront_scoop.text: Get out of here before I call the guard!

confront_scoop.speaker: You
confront_scoop.text: (You've seen enough. Chrysostom was right about this man.)

confront_scoop.speaker: System
confront_scoop.text: ✦ You observed the merchant's false weights. Return to Chrysostom. ✦

just_looking.speaker: Kyriakos
just_looking.text: Looking costs nothing. Buying costs coin. When you have some, come back.

just_looking.speaker: You
just_looking.text: (He turns to another customer—an old woman counting worn coins in her palm.)

just_looking.speaker: Kyriakos
just_looking.text: (To the woman) Ah, grandmother. Same as last week? That'll be four folles.

just_looking.speaker: Old Woman
just_looking.text: Four? It was three last week!

just_looking.speaker: Kyriakos
just_looking.text: Prices change. Ships from Egypt were delayed. Supply and demand, grandmother.

just_looking.speaker: You
just_looking.text: (You see sacks of grain stacked ten deep behind him. There's no shortage here.)

just_looking.speaker: Old Woman
just_looking.text: (She pays, but her hands shake. This was probably her only money.)

just_looking.speaker: System
just_looking.text: ✦ You witnessed the merchant's price gouging. ✦

choices.text: Actually, I want to buy grain.

prices_question.speaker: Kyriakos
prices_question.text: Good? Ha. With the taxes the Emperor demands? I barely scrape by.

prices_question.speaker: You
prices_question.text: (His rings say otherwise. That's Tyrian purple on his belt.)

prices_question.speaker: Kyriakos
prices_question.text: Everyone thinks merchants are rich. We're the ones who take all the risk.

prices_question.speaker: Kyriakos
prices_question.text: Ships sink. Grain rots. Thieves—(he looks at you)—steal.

prices_question.speaker: Kyriakos
prices_question.text: If prices seem high, blame the world, not me.

prices_question.speaker: You
prices_question.text: (Chrysostom's words echo: 'They hoard grain to drive up prices.')

take_grain.speaker: You
take_grain.text: (The grain is good, but there's less than there should be.)

take_grain.speaker: System
take_grain.text: You received grain—but not a full measure.

leave.speaker: You
leave.text: (You step away from the stall. Kyriakos has already forgotten you.)

lines.speaker: Kyriakos
lines.text: You again? I told you to leave!

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: I'm leaving. But you might want to think about who's watching.

lines.speaker: Kyriakos
lines.text: (He pales slightly.) What do you mean by that?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: The Archbishop has eyes everywhere. Just something to consider.

lines.speaker: Kyriakos
lines.text: (He laughs, but it's hollow.) Chrysostom? He preaches. That's all he does.

lines.speaker: Kyriakos
lines.text: The Empress protects men of business. We're the spine of the Empire.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (You leave him to his certainty. But you wonder how long it will last.)
